data.title: Kota Railway Division
data.meta_description: The Kota, headquartered at Kota, Rajasthan, is one of the 16 zones of Indian Railways.
data.text:
Kota railroad division is a piece of West Central Railway Zone of India. Its central command is in Kota. The division was shaped alongside Jabalpur railroad division. Kota Junction railroad station is a railroad station on the West Central railroad system. It is the base camp of Kota railroad division of West Central Railway zone. An expansive gage railroad office in the middle of Kota and Jodhpur by means of Jaipur exists. Kota is additionally a starting point for some trains such as Kota–Damoh Passenger (Kota–Katni Passenger) interfacing Kota to Damoh in Madhya Pradesh. Kota is the main station in Rajasthan took after by Jaipur and Ajmer, associated with all the significant urban communities of India.

Facts about Kota

Headquarters: Kota, Rajasthan

Location: Railway Colony, Railway Station Area, Kota, Rajasthan
